hu.elte.txtuml.api

Class ModelClass

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.elte.txtuml.api.StateMachine
      • hu.elte.txtuml.api.Region
        • hu.elte.txtuml.api.ModelClass
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelElement, ModelValue, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutAbstractNode, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutElement, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutNode, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutNonGroupElement

    public class ModelClass
extends Region
implements ModelValue, hu.elte.txtuml.layout.lang.elements.LayoutNode
    Base class for classes in the model.

    Represents: class

    Usage:

    Inherit from this class to define classes of the model. Fields of the subclass will represent attributes of the model class, methods will represent operations, while inheritance between subclasses of ModelClass will represent inheritance in the model. That means, due to the restrictions of Java, each model class may have at most one base class.

    See the documentation of StateMachine about applying state machines to model classes.

    Java restrictions:

    • Instantiate: disallowed
    • Define subtype: allowed

      Subtype requirements:

      • must be the nested class of a subclass of Model

      Subtype restrictions:

      • Be abstract: disallowed
      • Generic parameters: disallowed
      • Constructors: allowed, only with parameters of types which are subclasses of ModelValue
      • Initialization blocks: allowed, containing only simple assignments to set the default values of its fields
      • Fields: allowed, only of types which are subclasses of ModelValue; they represent attributes of the model class
      • Methods: allowed, only with parameters and return values of types which are subclasses of ModelValue; they represent operations of the model class
      • Nested interfaces: disallowed
      • Nested classes: allowed, only non-static and extending either StateMachine.Vertex or StateMachine.Transition
      • Nested enums: disallowed
    • Inherit from the defined subtype: allowed, to represent class inheritance

    Example: 

     
 class Employee extends ModelClass {
 
        ModelString name;
 
        ModelInt id;
 
        void work(ModelInt hours, ModelInt payment) {
                 //...
        }
  
         //...
  
 }
    See the documentation of StateMachine for detailed examples about defining state machines.

    See the documentation of Model for an overview on modeling in txtUML.

    Author:
    Gabor Ferenc Kovacs

      • assoc

        public <T extends ModelClass,AE extends AssociationEnd<T> & Navigability.Navigable> AE assoc(java.lang.Class<AE> otherEnd)
        Gets the collection containing the objects in association with this object and being on the specified opposite navigable association end. May not be called with a non-navigable association end as its parameter.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects which are on the opposite association end
        AE - the type of the opposite association end
        Parameters:
        otherEnd - the opposite association end
        Returns:
        collection containing the objects in association with this object and being on otherEnd
